synsets.definition: A malevolent energy or killing intent that emanates from a person, believed to cause harm or misfortune to others through spiritual hostility rather than physical action
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese concept linking hostile emotions to qi energy that can literally poison environments and relationships

synsets.definition: Supernatural retribution manifesting as persistent hostility from spirits or ancestors, often triggered by social violations or disrespect
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese belief that hostility can transcend death and manifest as ongoing spiritual antagonism affecting entire lineages

synsets.definition: Deep-seated grudge that festers across generations, creating cycles of familial or social hostility rooted in unresolved injustice
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept of transgenerational hostility that becomes embedded in family and social structures

synsets.definition: Hostile betrayal that violates sacred trust or dharmic duty, considered one of the gravest forms of social antagonism in Hindu ethics
synsets.cultural_note: Sanskrit concept emphasizing hostility as violation of cosmic order and social dharma

synsets.definition: Intense hatred that corrupts the soul and community bonds, explicitly condemned as spiritually destructive in Islamic teachings
synsets.cultural_note: Arabic Islamic concept viewing hostility as spiritual pollution that damages both individual and ummah

synsets.definition: Hostility so intense it allows the living person's malevolent spirit to harm others at a distance, similar to a curse from the living
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese belief that extreme hostility can manifest supernatural power while the person is still alive

synsets.definition: Malevolent hostility that spreads like spiritual contamination, poisoning social harmony and moral order
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese concept of hostility as infectious evil that disrupts cosmic and social balance

synsets.definition: Hostile intention manifested through supernatural means to harm others, representing the ultimate antisocial behavior in many African cultures
synsets.cultural_note: East African concept where hostility transcends human emotion to become supernatural threat to community

synsets.definition: Hostile actions that create negative karmic debt, ensuring future suffering for both perpetrator and victim across lifetimes
synsets.cultural_note: Thai Buddhist understanding of hostility as cosmic debt that perpetuates suffering across reincarnations

synsets.definition: Groundless hatred that destroys community bonds and is considered the root cause of national and spiritual catastrophe in Jewish thought
synsets.cultural_note: Hebrew concept holding that unfounded hostility can destroy entire civilizations and prevent spiritual redemption

synsets.definition: Hostile envy that seeks to destroy others' good fortune through supernatural means, considered a grave social sin in Ethiopian culture
synsets.cultural_note: Ethiopian concept linking hostility to destructive envy that threatens community prosperity through evil eye

synsets.definition: Hostile rejection of reciprocal obligations that maintains Andean social order, creating dangerous imbalance in community relationships
synsets.cultural_note: Andean concept where hostility manifests as refusal to participate in sacred reciprocal relationships

synsets.definition: Hostile spiritual force wielded to harm others through mystical means, representing the dark side of feminine spiritual power
synsets.cultural_note: Yoruba concept of hostility as misuse of spiritual power that can destroy individuals and communities

synsets.definition: Deep-rooted hostility that grows stronger over time, considered a spiritual poison that corrupts the heart in Persian Sufi thought
synsets.cultural_note: Persian concept viewing persistent hostility as spiritual disease that prevents mystical union with divine

synsets.definition: Hostile intention manifested through supernatural curses that can affect entire whakapapa (genealogical lines) across generations
synsets.cultural_note: Māori understanding of hostility as spiritual attack that can impact entire kinship networks through ancestral connections

synsets.definition: Hostile vow of revenge that invokes supernatural forces to ensure justice, binding the speaker to pursue retribution
synsets.cultural_note: Filipino concept where hostility becomes sacred obligation enforced by spiritual powers

synsets.definition: Malevolent use of traditional knowledge to harm others, representing the ultimate violation of harmony and balance in Navajo worldview
synsets.cultural_note: Navajo concept of hostility as perversion of sacred knowledge that disrupts cosmic harmony

synsets.definition: Deep hostility rooted in honor violations that demands satisfaction through retribution to restore family dignity
synsets.cultural_note: Turkish concept linking hostility to honor-shame dynamics that affect entire kinship groups

synsets.definition: Hostile words believed to carry spiritual power to cause misfortune, illness, or death through verbal attack
synsets.cultural_note: Mongolian belief that hostile speech can manifest as supernatural harm through spiritual power of words

synsets.definition: Hostile resentment from injustice that creates karmic debt requiring resolution across multiple lifetimes
synsets.cultural_note: Vietnamese Buddhist concept of hostility as karmic entanglement that binds souls together in cycles of revenge

synsets.definition: Person who embodies antisocial hostility through harmful magic, representing complete rejection of ubuntu and community bonds
synsets.cultural_note: Zulu concept of hostility personified as one who actively destroys community harmony through supernatural malevolence

synsets.definition: Hostile ghost of person who died with unresolved anger, continuing to harm the living through supernatural manifestations
synsets.cultural_note: Burmese belief that extreme hostility can prevent peaceful death and create malevolent spirits

synsets.definition: Malevolent spiritual entity born from accumulated hostile karma, representing pure antagonism toward all sentient beings
synsets.cultural_note: Tibetan Buddhist concept of hostility as spiritual state that can manifest as demonic rebirth

synsets.definition: Spiritual practitioner who uses sacred knowledge for hostile purposes, violating the reciprocal relationship between human and natural worlds
synsets.cultural_note: Guaraní concept of hostility as perversion of sacred relationship with nature spirits

synsets.definition: Hostile force that affects entire lineages through violations of ancestral taboos, manifesting as persistent misfortune across generations
synsets.cultural_note: Berber understanding of hostility as transgenerational spiritual contamination affecting entire family lines
